SEARCH
Package enums

Enum Class UserRole

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<UserRole>
enums.UserRole
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<UserRole>, Constable
public enum UserRole extends Enum<UserRole>
Enumeration representing the different user roles in the system.

This enum defines the three types of users who can access the Internship Placement Management System, each with distinct permissions and capabilities.

Role Descriptions:

  • STUDENT: Can browse internships, submit applications (max 3), accept placements (max 1), and request withdrawals
  • COMPANY_REPRESENTATIVE: Can create internships (max 5), review applications, approve/reject applicants, toggle visibility
  • CAREER_CENTER_STAFF: Can authorize representatives, approve internship opportunities, process withdrawals, generate reports

User ID Formats:

  • Students: Start with 'U', followed by 7 digits, end with a letter (e.g., U2345123F)
  • Company Representatives: Company email address
  • Career Center Staff: NTU account
Since:
2025-10-14
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
SC2002 SCED Group-6

  • Enum Constant Details

    • STUDENT

      public static final UserRole STUDENT
      Student role - can browse and apply for internships. Automatically registered by reading from student list file.

    • COMPANY_REPRESENTATIVE

      public static final UserRole COMPANY_REPRESENTATIVE
      Company representative role - can post internships and review applications. Must register and be authorized by career center staff before login.

    • CAREER_CENTER_STAFF

      public static final UserRole CAREER_CENTER_STAFF
      Career center staff role - can approve accounts, internships, and withdrawals. Automatically registered by reading from staff list file.
